005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.hal.HAL;
008import edu.wpi.first.hal.HALUtil;
009import edu.wpi.first.hal.LEDJNI;
010import edu.wpi.first.hal.PowerJNI;
011import edu.wpi.first.hal.can.CANJNI;
012import edu.wpi.first.hal.can.CANStatus;
013
014/** Contains functions for roboRIO functionality. */
015public final class RobotController {
016  private RobotController() {
017    throw new UnsupportedOperationException("This is a utility class!");
018  }
019
020  /**
021   * Return the FPGA Version number. For now, expect this to be the current year.
022   *
023   * @return FPGA Version number.
024   */
025  public static int getFPGAVersion() {
026    return HALUtil.getFPGAVersion();
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Return the FPGA Revision number. The format of the revision is 3 numbers. The 12 most
031   * significant bits are the Major Revision. the next 8 bits are the Minor Revision. The 12 least
032   * significant bits are the Build Number.
033   *
034   * @return FPGA Revision number.
035   */
036  public static long getFPGARevision() {
037    return HALUtil.getFPGARevision();
038  }
039
040  /**
041   * Return the serial number of the roboRIO.
042   *
043   * @return The serial number of the roboRIO.
044   */
045  public static String getSerialNumber() {
046    return HALUtil.getSerialNumber();
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Return the comments from the roboRIO web interface.
051   *
052   * <p>The comments string is cached after the first call to this function on the RoboRIO - restart
053   * the robot code to reload the comments string after changing it in the web interface.
054   *
055   * @return the comments from the roboRIO web interface.
056   */
057  public static String getComments() {
058    return HALUtil.getComments();
059  }
060
061  /**
062   * Returns the team number configured for the robot controller.
063   *
064   * @return team number, or 0 if not found.
065   */
066  public static int getTeamNumber() {
067    return HALUtil.getTeamNumber();
068  }
069
070  /**
071   * Read the microsecond timer from the FPGA.
072   *
073   * @return The current time in microseconds according to the FPGA.
074   */
075  public static long getFPGATime() {
076    return HALUtil.getFPGATime();
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Get the state of the "USER" button on the roboRIO.
081   *
082   * <p>Warning: the User Button is used to stop user programs from automatically loading if it is
083   * held for more then 5 seconds. Because of this, it's not recommended to be used by teams for any
084   * other purpose.
085   *
086   * @return true if the button is currently pressed down
087   */
088  public static boolean getUserButton() {
089    return HALUtil.getFPGAButton();
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Read the battery voltage.
094   *
095   * @return The battery voltage in Volts.
096   */
097  public static double getBatteryVoltage() {
098    return PowerJNI.getVinVoltage();
099  }
100
101  /**
102   * Gets a value indicating whether the FPGA outputs are enabled. The outputs may be disabled if
103   * the robot is disabled or e-stopped, the watchdog has expired, or if the roboRIO browns out.
104   *
105   * @return True if the FPGA outputs are enabled.
106   */
107  public static boolean isSysActive() {
108    return HAL.getSystemActive();
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Check if the system is browned out.
113   *
114   * @return True if the system is browned out
115   */
116  public static boolean isBrownedOut() {
117    return HAL.getBrownedOut();
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Gets the number of times the system has been disabled due to communication errors with the
122   * Driver Station.
123   *
124   * @return number of disables due to communication errors.
125   */
126  public static int getCommsDisableCount() {
127    return HAL.getCommsDisableCount();
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Gets the current state of the Robot Signal Light (RSL).
132   *
133   * @return The current state of the RSL- true if on, false if off
134   */
135  public static boolean getRSLState() {
136    return HAL.getRSLState();
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Gets if the system time is valid.
141   *
142   * @return True if the system time is valid, false otherwise
143   */
144  public static boolean isSystemTimeValid() {
145    return HAL.getSystemTimeValid();
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Get the input voltage to the robot controller.
150   *
151   * @return The controller input voltage value in Volts
152   */
153  public static double getInputVoltage() {
154    return PowerJNI.getVinVoltage();
155  }
156
157  /**
158   * Get the input current to the robot controller.
159   *
160   * @return The controller input current value in Amps
161   */
162  public static double getInputCurrent() {
163    return PowerJNI.getVinCurrent();
164  }
165
166  /**
167   * Get the voltage of the 3.3V rail.
168   *
169   * @return The controller 3.3V rail voltage value in Volts
170   */
171  public static double getVoltage3V3() {
172    return PowerJNI.getUserVoltage3V3();
173  }
174
175  /**
176   * Get the current output of the 3.3V rail.
177   *
178   * @return The controller 3.3V rail output current value in Amps
179   */
180  public static double getCurrent3V3() {
181    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrent3V3();
182  }
183
184  /**
185   * Enables or disables the 3.3V rail.
186   *
187   * @param enabled whether to enable the 3.3V rail.
188   */
189  public static void setEnabled3V3(boolean enabled) {
190    PowerJNI.setUserEnabled3V3(enabled);
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Get the enabled state of the 3.3V rail. The rail may be disabled due to a controller brownout,
195   * a short circuit on the rail, or controller over-voltage.
196   *
197   * @return The controller 3.3V rail enabled value
198   */
199  public static boolean getEnabled3V3() {
200    return PowerJNI.getUserActive3V3();
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Get the count of the total current faults on the 3.3V rail since the code started.
205   *
206   * @return The number of faults
207   */
208  public static int getFaultCount3V3() {
209    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrentFaults3V3();
210  }
211
212  /**
213   * Get the voltage of the 5V rail.
214   *
215   * @return The controller 5V rail voltage value in Volts
216   */
217  public static double getVoltage5V() {
218    return PowerJNI.getUserVoltage5V();
219  }
220
221  /**
222   * Get the current output of the 5V rail.
223   *
224   * @return The controller 5V rail output current value in Amps
225   */
226  public static double getCurrent5V() {
227    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrent5V();
228  }
229
230  /**
231   * Enables or disables the 5V rail.
232   *
233   * @param enabled whether to enable the 5V rail.
234   */
235  public static void setEnabled5V(boolean enabled) {
236    PowerJNI.setUserEnabled5V(enabled);
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Get the enabled state of the 5V rail. The rail may be disabled due to a controller brownout, a
241   * short circuit on the rail, or controller over-voltage.
242   *
243   * @return The controller 5V rail enabled value
244   */
245  public static boolean getEnabled5V() {
246    return PowerJNI.getUserActive5V();
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Get the count of the total current faults on the 5V rail since the code started.
251   *
252   * @return The number of faults
253   */
254  public static int getFaultCount5V() {
255    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrentFaults5V();
256  }
257
258  /**
259   * Get the voltage of the 6V rail.
260   *
261   * @return The controller 6V rail voltage value in Volts
262   */
263  public static double getVoltage6V() {
264    return PowerJNI.getUserVoltage6V();
265  }
266
267  /**
268   * Get the current output of the 6V rail.
269   *
270   * @return The controller 6V rail output current value in Amps
271   */
272  public static double getCurrent6V() {
273    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrent6V();
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Enables or disables the 6V rail.
278   *
279   * @param enabled whether to enable the 6V rail.
280   */
281  public static void setEnabled6V(boolean enabled) {
282    PowerJNI.setUserEnabled6V(enabled);
283  }
284
285  /**
286   * Get the enabled state of the 6V rail. The rail may be disabled due to a controller brownout, a
287   * short circuit on the rail, or controller over-voltage.
288   *
289   * @return The controller 6V rail enabled value
290   */
291  public static boolean getEnabled6V() {
292    return PowerJNI.getUserActive6V();
293  }
294
295  /**
296   * Get the count of the total current faults on the 6V rail since the code started.
297   *
298   * @return The number of faults
299   */
300  public static int getFaultCount6V() {
301    return PowerJNI.getUserCurrentFaults6V();
302  }
303
304  /** Reset the overcurrent fault counters for all user rails to 0. */
305  public static void resetRailFaultCounts() {
306    PowerJNI.resetUserCurrentFaults();
307  }
308
309  /**
310   * Get the current brownout voltage setting.
311   *
312   * @return The brownout voltage
313   */
314  public static double getBrownoutVoltage() {
315    return PowerJNI.getBrownoutVoltage();
316  }
317
318  /**
319   * Set the voltage the roboRIO will brownout and disable all outputs.
320   *
321   * <p>Note that this only does anything on the roboRIO 2. On the roboRIO it is a no-op.
322   *
323   * @param brownoutVoltage The brownout voltage
324   */
325  public static void setBrownoutVoltage(double brownoutVoltage) {
326    PowerJNI.setBrownoutVoltage(brownoutVoltage);
327  }
328
329  /**
330   * Get the current CPU temperature in degrees Celsius.
331   *
332   * @return current CPU temperature in degrees Celsius
333   */
334  public static double getCPUTemp() {
335    return PowerJNI.getCPUTemp();
336  }
337
338  /** State for the radio led. */
339  public enum RadioLEDState {
340    /** Off. */
341    kOff(LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_OFF),
342    /** Green. */
343    kGreen(LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_GREEN),
344    /** Red. */
345    kRed(LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_RED),
346    /** Orange. */
347    kOrange(LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_ORANGE);
348
349    /** The native value for this state. */
350    public final int value;
351
352    RadioLEDState(int value) {
353      this.value = value;
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * Gets a state from an int value.
358     *
359     * @param value int value
360     * @return state
361     */
362    public static RadioLEDState fromValue(int value) {
363      return switch (value) {
364        case LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_OFF -> RadioLEDState.kOff;
365        case LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_GREEN -> RadioLEDState.kGreen;
366        case LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_RED -> RadioLEDState.kRed;
367        case LEDJNI.RADIO_LED_STATE_ORANGE -> RadioLEDState.kOrange;
368        default -> RadioLEDState.kOff;
369      };
370    }
371  }
372
373  /**
374   * Set the state of the "Radio" LED. On the RoboRIO, this writes to sysfs, so this function should
375   * not be called multiple times per loop cycle to avoid overruns.
376   *
377   * @param state The state to set the LED to.
378   */
379  public static void setRadioLEDState(RadioLEDState state) {
380    LEDJNI.setRadioLEDState(state.value);
381  }
382
383  /**
384   * Get the state of the "Radio" LED. On the RoboRIO, this reads from sysfs, so this function
385   * should not be called multiple times per loop cycle to avoid overruns.
386   *
387   * @return The state of the LED.
388   */
389  public static RadioLEDState getRadioLEDState() {
390    return RadioLEDState.fromValue(LEDJNI.getRadioLEDState());
391  }
392
393  /**
394   * Get the current status of the CAN bus.
395   *
396   * @return The status of the CAN bus
397   */
398  public static CANStatus getCANStatus() {
399    CANStatus status = new CANStatus();
400    CANJNI.getCANStatus(status);
401    return status;
402  }
403}
